review: My friend & I stopped here for some conversation & dinner. Was a little afraid after I read the reviews. .  We were sat pretty fast. Ordered. I had a salad. It was good. My friend ordered the flat bread. She said it tasted stale.  Service was pretty good. We had two waitresses. One was getting trained. So it had to be easier with two of them.

With two kids, we thought this restaurants would be a good place to eat on a Tuesday night. On Tuesday evenings, kids eat free. But it would have been worth the time to pay full price elsewhere. We waited almost an hour to receive our food. Kids were hungry and restless but we stuck it out waiting. When our food finally arrived, it was cold and crusty. My $11 burger was mediocre at best. When our check came, we only got one kid's plate for free after they told us that both kid's plates would be free. When we asked the waitress to check our receipt and make the adjustment, a second waitress walked by and gave us attitude.  We will not be back and hope you have a better experience than we did.  All in all, the waitress was nice and kind to us .

So this is our 3rd time visiting this place. Both of our earlier visits were at night, and the experience was ok, but the food was good so we decided to try and go in today for lunch. Bad idea. It began when we first walked in. The host sat us in a table where 4 people would sit comfortably, (we're 5), but we took it because we were hungry and figured that wasn't a deal breaker for us. We then noticed the table was dirty, and instead of moving us, he came back with a wet cloth and let us know that it was 'sanitizer' and proceeded to clean the table half ass. Then and there should have been reason enough to leave, but again, having hungry kids made us try and make the best of the situation. So, waitress comes over, she seemed friendly enough and took our orders. I kid you not, 5 mins after we placed our order, she comes up to my 10 year old and says, "Sweetie, we don't have any pepperoni for your pizza, is cheese ok?" My son said ok and proceeded to wait for our food. Like 3 mins later, she comes back again and tells me, "Ma'am, I'm sorry, we ran out of Brussel sprouts, is there something else you'd like instead?" I had my heart set on it, but asked for a side salad. This was during lunch time, at 1pm, and already they were running out of their menu items. 25 mins passed, and we were contemplating leaving. I regret that we didn't after our food came out. I ordered a 2 for grill item, I chose a sirloin with parmesan crusted chicken. I swear to you, I don't know how small that chicken was, but it was even tinier than a chicken strip. I cut into it and it was rubbery. Sirloin was ok, but it had no seasoning whatsoever. My husband ordered that burger that comes with a wing on top, the wing was cold, almost as if they defrosted it, but not thoroughly. To top it off, our waitress continuously checked in on other diners, but not us. We are never going back there. Please save your money. Its overpriced and so not worth it.

We came in 12 deep the wait was expected but not like other restaurants near by(2hr wait). Our server Sadie was amazing she was super friendly and very very very patient with my entire family. The food came out with no mistakes. Everyone enjoyed the food with no complaints. We where a little skeptical of the past reviews but by far exceeded everyones expectations. Sadie and all the lady servers are amazing. Will definitely be back for the amazing service.

Has the food gotten worse?  I don't understand what was wrong with the spinach artichoke dip?! They changed it to some slimy spinach dip with weird cheese curds. Tastes so weird!!! Disgusting texture! Fix that. Homemade chips were chewy! Some were ok.. burger wasn't medium.. it was a typical Friday burger.. I swear they up'd the prices and made the food semi worse lol I guess you can't expect too much at these chain restaurants anymore.. the chefs don't care so they're all .. ehh.. smh
We loved our visit! I'm vegan & the beyond meat burger was delicious!! Also loved our waitress, I wish I knew her name! We tipped 20 on a 42 bc our experience was amazing!
Placed an order to go and I guess this is what you get. It looks like I ate half my meal and then packed the left overs. Definitely not worth the $15 for the amount you get.

The customer service was very good. Our server was sweet and friendly. Refills on time, suggestions on food.  On the other hand food not so good. A friend and I decided to get the Endless apps. We expected fresh tasting wings and pot stickers but instead got mildly cold and bland tasting food. We seriously think everything we ordered was frozen and then just warm up in the microwave or something . We got their meatballs (that we did not order) and you know meat balls are usually very flavorful especially with sauce on top, nope this tasted like something my dog would eat. I make better meat balls.. (I really do) maybe I expected to much. Oh and my pot stickers has a hair from their sauce brush. I freaked out until they explain what was going on. Lol

I honestly hate leaving bad reviews but the service here is just so bad, you will seriously sit and wait for your food for so long and they're so slow serving everything . Then on top of that the food comes out cold We won't return here anymore

Wish I could give less than one star!  Went there last night (Wednesday) they were not at all busy. My husband and I sat in the bar area. Took 15 min before anyone even acknowledged us. The we ordered 2 draft beers. They brought one in about 10 min and said the keg was empty for the other beer and they would being it right away nearly 20 min later the second beer got there. We ordered an appetizer queso artichoke dip and chips. Took FOREVER! We were waiting on our daughter to get there to order dinner and decided that because the service was so SLOW, we would eat elsewhere. Lost my business. It would have been different if they had been busy but they were not at all busy. If you eat there make sure you have hours to kill!

My wife and I believe Julia is an amazing waitress as she was very courteous and pleasant during our visit.  My wife said her 12oz beer was good; however, the appetizer we ordered (potato skins) was extremely dry.  Our waitress removed the cost of the appetizer, so we were grateful for that; however we decided to pay for our drinks, tipped Julia, and decided to eat elsewhere.

Not even busy and it took 21 minutes to get water.  47 minutes for our apps. Chicken wings were cold.  Chicken sandwich was overly greasy.  Tgif has gone downhill since the last time.  Worse than Applebees. Gave us a 20% discount and comped our app. But still not worth the 45 bucks we spent on pre frozen patties and crappy fries. A better burger place would have been redrobin but they were closed.  Won't be going back. Sad, because i loved tgif.

Terrible server ruined our dining experience. She literally talked me out of ordering three different items. Server didn't come to our table for 10 minutes. Had to hit the need assistance on the smart device on the table. Entrees all came out wrong. Will not come back because of this experience.

The only reason I didn't give this place 1 star is because I like the appetizers. However, the service is terrible. It took them 10 minutes just for the server to approach the table and ask about drinks. Then on top of that it took 25 minutes just to get appetizers which I know takes maybe 10 minutes to make. I will definitely not be coming back to this location.

This place sucks so bad I would not even feed my dog the food. The waitress was not funny and her jokes were stupid. Ordered a bacon cheeseburger medium well, so the burger comes out first bit not bad second bit saw a little pink third bit its raw. Told the waitress this burger is raw I want it cooked more please. She replies "oh a little to pink for you we can share it i like it" and walks away. So I kind of sit there not knowing what to think, but I assumed that she was going to the kitchen to have a new one made well i was wrong i had to bring it to her attention once again. So she finally goes and has them make me a new one. Waited 25 minuets or longer... for a burger and let me tell you they must have cooked this thing the entire 25 minutes i was waiting because that sucker was like a hockey puck. So if this place wants to survive get new cooks and new management and finally some new waiters/waitresses that don't want to share the raw food that can make you sick.

The quality is going down and the prices are going up. How do you raise the prices $4 at a time?!?!?! Endless appetizers went from $9.99 to $13.99. They got rid of their awesome Mac n cheese and replaced it with Kraft. If you want that or Brussel sprouts with your meal you have to pay an extra $3 each. Thats bullshit. They also got rid of the mozzarella tomato salad. We went there the other day and after hearing all this we cancelled our orders and left. The tables are also always sticky and the food takes forever. We won't be back. Oh and I forgot to add if you don't take your leftovers with you (I was eating a salad and my boyfriend was eating something that wouldn't have reheated well) this one weirdo manager will guilt trip you for it... "don't you have kids you can give it to, or a neighbor" uh I paid for my food and can do whatever I want, I'm not a wasteful person but salad wilts overnight and my boyfriends dish very honestly wouldn't have tasted any better the next day. Maybe she was high on the pain meds she claimed to be addicted to.

Got to tgif and was seated as soon as we walked in it seamed that they had bigger parties to seat. The waitress Hailey was nice and sweet, but it seamed she was all over the place. ... she  checked with us every once in a while.  Ordered our drinks and appetizers and we got them in a great timely manner.  Ordered or food and also received it on time.  My jack Daniel chicken was a bit dry but really good flavor.  It was nice to get two decent size chicken best.
Run some where else if your in any type of a hurry. Four managers on duty and it took 45 min for a burger n pasta.

Ordered French Dip, The bread was stale, and dipping sauce was tasteless. My husband ordered fish and chips received about the same quality as Long John Silvers.  The quality of the food at TGIF's has declined to that of fast food restaurant, Save your 40 bucks and go through a drive-through.

Run as fast as you can to Karl Strauss next door.  One full hour from waiting for a table (while it's slow on a Tuesday night and there's 2 parties of 8+). Magically after complaining (which I hate to do) the food arrives in minutes. the food and plate was hot - probably on a heat lamp for god know how long. The food was .. consumable. My wife's drink glass is cracked nearly thru around the cup - do they not pay attention..? On top of it all, We have a 2 year old and the poor dude was so starving hungry and grumpy I felt so bad.  The manager doles out sorries and appetizer vouchers, but why would I come back here to use them? They split the check but ended up duplicating it from one side of the split. How does anyone here dress themselves every day? This has to be a depressing place to work. One star for the server at least being friendly. TGIDGFP. (Thank god I didn't get food poisoning).

Will never go back. Never got our appetizers. Took an hour and a half to get our food. Which was cold and my fiances food had hair in it. It took another half hour to get them to acknowledge us to talk about the food. When we did all she did was ask if she could get more sauce for my burger because it had none on it. Btw the table across the way got our appetizers. We never received them through out our entire meal. Which we actually didn't eat.

$55 down the drain. My coworker and I decided to give TGI Fridays a shot tonight since neither of us had ever been here, and I'm thoroughly disappointed. It was a mess from the second we walked in. We stood in the entry way for at least 5 minutes before we came to the conclusion that we must just have to pick a seat. Meanwhile, at least three servers made eye contact with the two of us. They only decided to serve us when they saw that we decided to just go take a seat at one of the tables. Then came the food, we got the Jack Daniels appetizer sampler thing to split and two entrees. We also had ordered the nachos, but they never came. So for the sampler: the ribs were good, and shrimp was good, but the chicken strips were burnt and drowned in sauce. The Cajun Chicken and Shrimp pasta: the Alfredo was already separated, you could literally see the pools of orange grease all over the plate. Leading me to believe that they just have preportioned servings of the sauce just sitting in a cooler waiting to be heated up in a microwave. Sizzling chicken and cheese: coworker said the chicken had no flavor. Mind you, that plate was about $18 for two pieces of bland chicken atop a boiling puddle of cheese with two scoops of mashed potatoes plopped on the other side of the skillet. $18!!!! After an email coupon that eliminated the entire cost of one of the entrees, we still ended up with a bill of $45.01. Then with tip we payed $55. So irritating. Could have bought two whole 2 for $20 deals at Applebee's and the quality would have been 40x better. Can't believe how outrageously priced this disgusting food is. This place doesn't live up to the hype at all.
Half star place is a shit hole and smells like a urinal customer service does not exist. Do everyone a favor and just close. Actually place is a fire hazard. Thanks

Horrible! Came here 3 weeks ago with my son we were seated at 4:45pm Hoping to eat then catch a movie at 6pm. With an EMPTY restaurant our food came at 5:45pm and it was COLD like it sat under an AC vent for 15min before being brought to our table. Fast forward to last week. Tried this place again with my gf. I dropped her off and she went in to pee while I parked. I came in didn't see her seated so I asked for a table for 2 after waiting 5 minutes for the greeter to even come up and seat us. While waiting another couple came in and were waiting behind me. As the seater came up and I told her table for 2 she said ok but the lady behind me was here first basically telling me I cut the line and I was the only one there for like 3 minutes! So after insulting me the lady behind me said he was here first so then we got seated. After waiting 15min to place our order, an hour later our food came. This time they forgot to add the veggies to my gf plate and forgot to add my spinach to my plate. HOW DO YOU FORGET TO COMPLETE THE PLATES PER YOUR OWN FREAKIN MENU! This place is horrible. Service sucks and the food was not that great either time. NEVER AGAIN! Go anywhere but here folks this place sucks!

I can completely understand the two star rating that this restaurant now. Took about 30 minutes and then it took us about another 45 minutes to receive the food. And this time the table next to us had their complete order Comped because of the service.  And the only reason why I mention that is because the manager walked by us probably a dozen times and didn't acknowledge us at all. I don't like leaving a negative review especially at a place that I used to enjoy, but something had to be said for the way this evening went from my wife and my two sons.

Can Friday's get any worse. Saw all the bad reviews but these endless appetizer commercials made me want to try Friday's one more time. The food they serve doesn't look anything like the commercial. The commercial shows a plate of 8 potato skins being served up. We were given 4. The commercial shows a plate of 6 qusedea on a plate, we only got 3. Each appetizer cost $10 so we ordered refills that were supposed to be free and endless.  We ordered chicken wings and were given some kind of honey crispy boneless chicken minus any of the ranch dressing, celery or carrot sticks that they show in their commercials. Our bill showed 6 to 8$ for each refill that they were never supposed to charge us for. Between the long wait for each refill and the disparity in the food quality, I just paid my bill and couldn't wait to get out of there. I've watched all these restaurants close in different cities and this one can't be too far behind.

This place doesn't even deserve 1 star! Just had the worst service in my entire life. We got there at 12:30 am knowing their kitchen closed at 1am because I called before coming to double check. Walked in and no one acknowledged that I had even walked in. There was a server who was standing right there at a table in the bar area and looked at me and didn't even say one word. Not hey just give me one second, NOTHING! So I decided to just seat myself but had to ask the bartender if it was open seating. He said that's cool, sit wherever. Thinking once we sat down that someone would come over and acknowledge the fact that we were sitting there. The same server who looked at me in the beginning passed out table atleast 3 times and never once stopped asking for our drink orders or even food, knowing the kitchen was closing soon. Total bs. Then to make matters worse there were employees walking around aimlessly not even batting an eye at the fact that no one had come over to take care of us. And then the icing on the cake was when the bartender was taking alcohol bottle and tossing them up in the air juggling. Rather than taking care of his section. Sat there for a total of 15 mins and not a single person did it said anything. I decided to walk out and take my money elsewhere. So sad and pathetic.
I can't believe the wait for chicken wings! If you are doing endless apps don't go here slow service. Sad!

Service was less than great... server left dirty dishes on the table the whole time we ate.  Food was unsatisfying. Don't understand why we ran into so many problems seeing as the restaurant was not even half full, clearly under maintained. I love this chain but this location is trash.

Work across from this TGI Fridays and decided to have lunch there with a couple of girls at work. We noticed there were only a few other people there so we assumed this would be fast. Our food took 30-40 minutes to come to the table, we only had a few minutes to eat and get back to work. We told our waiter that we needed to go so he then decided to take a long time to get our checks. We had to ask the hostess to take our cards cause our waiter walked off when we were trying to hand it to him. Barely made it back in time to clock in. Eat here if you have all day to wait for service.

Went to dinner with a party of 4. Waitress was not helpful and not friendly. Waited a long while for refills and for check ups.  Food was great and put out in a timely manner.  I give this place 3/5 because the food was good.  Other than that, service sucks.

To make long story short we had bad service .. After being sat we waited good 10 minutes with no drinks nobody had stopped by our table to ask us if we been helped or asked us for drinks... minutes later Jenni  said she would be right with us. Tell me why she took forever to come back if the restaurant was empty?! Never coming back to this place My husband and I decided to leave we went to Red Robin. Poor customer service at TGIF.

We walked in and greated by someone who didn't want to be there. My wife asked if we could sit by the window and was asked if we really wanted to sit there. While seated we could smell a moldy musty smell. It was a very strong odor. If you look at the bottom of the booths you could see why. We never saw a server, and the place was not busy. The place is disgusting. We ended up walking out before anyone came by.

I ordered the skillet garlic shrimp and the pick 3 appetizers. My appetizers were cold. We ate it anyways. Then our waitress didn't even follow up with our table constantly. No forks and knives. And we had to wait for drink refills. My skillet garlic shrimp was 90% cheese. I asked the waitress if it's supposed to have this much cheese. Her response "I don't know I think it's supposed to look like that." Really...it's supposed to look like it has 90% cheese? She could've offered to get me something different but no. I didn't even touch my food. I feel like throwing up with the amounts of cheese in one bite.  To top it off she messed up our split bills. The receipts were not even in the right tabs. My store copy was in my friends tab and his was in mine. Terrible service. Not coming here again. Cold food and terrible waitress.
What's this place called ?? Trash? Yeah that's what the service and the food. Save your self from coming here.

I like this place, the service and the food is very good! We have eaten here several times and every time the food is done properly and the service is great. I have also ordered take out when it gets crazy and crowded, which is a nice option when you don't want to cook and don't feel like sitting at a restaurant, but want to enjoy good quality food that isn't just fast food. I will usually place an order over the phone and it's ready for pick up in 15 to 20 minutes, which is great when the place is really busy over the weekends. The ribs are really good and their steaks are always done according to how you order them. Overall this is a great place and we have enjoyed dining in as a family or getting take out.

Beer taste flat. The bartender who looks like a over sized douchey Taylor Laughtner is attractive but not friendly. Not even busy and he was lagging...(we get it that your attractive and a bartender but you don't have to act like a douche).  Soo many dirty tables, I guess they don't have anyone bussing during the day...I also feel like none of the staff checks their yelps because everyone thinks the service is terrible and now I am here and the service is still terrible...10 thumbs down... come on TGI Fridays get your stuff together!!!!

I,and my daughter went there on 7-1-17, and my grandson Nolan who is 2 yrs, that is the chalenge two can be alot of work.our server was a lovely lady named Lilian my copmliments go out to her while the food was good I would say she was better so kind and sweet to our Nolan .I thought she must have been a manager but she was not.She is the reason we will return here.

The bartenders are drunk. I've been here an hour with maybe 2 other partys here and I barely just got my food. My boyfriend ordered the endless appetizers and after waiting this long to get the food they ended up ordering the wrong appetizer. Like I literally feel like you have to try hard to give this bad of service. It's almost comical. Also I sat and listened to one of the girls behind the bar tell a customer how she bought a bra and panties today and they were flirting back and forth. Yikes. I'll be calling corporate in the morning.

We came here for the unlimited appetizers.  To start it off it was a friday, and it was pretty busy. We waited quite a while to get in. Our waitress was really good, unfortunately she was stuck running around. The kitchen on the other hand.. dude. The only reason I'm giving a 3 is because of our waitress. We came in around 7, waited apx 30 minutes and got a seat in the bar. Our waitress came over quickly and got our drinks and appetizers settled. That's where the over 3 hour adventure began.  We got our first appetizers within 15 minutes. Not an awful wait, but stuff was missing. The potato skins looked awful. Little to no cheese on most, 1-2 bacon bits on each, no chives, they hardly put sour cream in the dish. We also had mozzarella sticks but those are hard to mess up. We put in our next order as soon as we got them...  An hour after placing our order, we'd been sitting there for 50 of that with no food, a small pile of wings get there with hardly any sauce (supposed to be jack Daniels sauce) as well as our other appetizer. Great. Eat that and we have our next order placed, within 20 minutes.  Another hour and it gets there. By the time we got that it was literally 945 and we were tired of the noise and being there, so the waitress was able to get us a box even though I guess she wasn't supposed to. Which was cool.  Overall nice front of the house staff, but what's up in the kitchen?????

Awful service, cold food, grumpy employees.  Pretty much sums it up. We for lunch on Saturday and it was EMPTY.  Took 10 mins to get drinks, another 15 to place and order, nearly 30 to get a soup and salad along with a couple kids meals and then 10 mins after we were all clearly done eating to get the bill.  There were 2 tables in our section and our waitress never bothered to refill drinks. Had to get what I think was the manager to simply refill my kids juice and she scoffed at my request, taking 10 mins to refill a kids apple juice. Will never go back.   I don't know what Friday's is trying to reinvent itself as but menu prices are through the roof and service was awful.  Find a different place to eat.

I sat for over an hour, with an empty glass, waiting on my food. Our server walked past my wife and I no less then ten times without even a look in our direction. After I forced her to stop and asked about the delayed time she said there was a problem in the kitchen even though all the other customers, even those who arrived thirty minutes after us, already had their food and were leaving. I will never eat here again.

Great spot to meet coworkers after work. Service was fast and  awesome, and I can't begin to say enough about the "Endless Aps". Plenty of monitors surround the interestingly decorated walls so that you can keep up with sport scores and news. The lights are dimmed down slightly creating a relaxing atmosphere. Food was good as well as hot which paired well with a good cold beverage. I like this place,,, I like it a lot!

I will not be coming back here ever again. The last time we came, the service wasn't great. But I guess it wasn't terrible enough to stand out in my mind. Tonight was different.  We were seated immediately. After about 10 minutes, someone offered to start our drinks. A few minutes later our waitress brought them. We weren't quite ready... first mistake. We waited for another 8-10 minutes for to come back. We almost left but we didn't.  Second mistake.  We opted to order the endless apps and side salad each, hoping this would make the food come out a bit quicker. Nope. My husband's beer came reasonably. After maybe 15 minutes we got our salads. We finished them and sat.... and sat... and about 40 minutes after we had ordered, and my husband canceled the apps and asked for the check. The waitress then brought our mozzarella sticks and said the wings didn't look good so she wouldn't bring them out. She agreed to take it off our bill and the manager came and gave us our check. No one apologized.  I gave 2 stars because we did get to eat the mozzarella sticks before leaving and they tasted good.  Not sure if their strategy for endless apps is to take so long you won't want to order more? But we won't be back!
ordered take out special rack of ribs and 2 sides 12.99 rlbs needed to cook few hours more we've had it before but last night was so bad I wouldn't go back

so, I came here to get dinner and I walked into a club. Live DJ music way to loud..the DJ kept messing with the treble pitch that made the music super annoying. food was TGIFs so it was decent But the bar club music was not expected.

This restaurant has been getting worse and worse. Horrible service! Takes forever to have someone come to the table to not only greet us but to take our order. Food comes out cold and or under cooked. Always have to send something back. Just not happy at all with this place. Avoid if you can.

Horrible. This place is DIRTY. The tables were dirty and sticky, the restroom was dirty and there was no hand towel at around 12pm when they just opened for lunch.. they were not even ready for the customers. There were 2 more tables and our food took more than 40 min.  And one of the girl server was sitting on a empty table and singing out loud. They were not doing their job but just wanted to make tips from customers.
Went at Lunch time on a Saturday we were seated right away. Server was super friendly! Food was delivered fast and was great!
I'm only leaving 5 star because of the manager Kelly. I won't go into details bashing the restaurant about our experience because the manager took care of us tonight.

First of all I believe they should have less than one star available for ratings.  I understand when restaurants are open on Thanksgiving there could be issues. However from the beginning of my visit if I hadn't been hungry I would have left. It took almost 15 minutes to get a table despite the fact they were many empty tables hadn't been cleared. The place was basically in shambles. As for my waiter I was fully aware it was his 3rd day a on the job as he told me at least 5 times during our entire interactions. I mentioned to him to stop telling me this over and over again he then didn't come back the table at all. I understand his inexperience however the person truly to be blamed is his supervisor for not training him well and not giving him the tools necessary to be successful. As for my food well the steak and broccoli were decent however my mashed potatoes tasted like glue when I brought it to his attention he did bring over his supervisor who offered to swap them out for something. I explained to her I was raised not to waste food and ate them anyway. What I did ask is for her to go in the kitchen herself and taste them. When I did get around to ordering dessert once it was placed it took almost 15 minutes for the cheesecake to arrive at that point I asked for it to go and I even had to ask a different person about its earlier status. The manager never came out to ask me about the rest of my meal nor did I see my waiter again. When I did use the self service machine to pay for my bill and didn't get a copy of my receipt I had to ask several people just for a copy of it which again took way to long. Also had to endure watching the table next to me experience the same issues but magnified because they had a large party. I would hope this is just an isolated incident at one location and maybe I will try again at the location near my home.
Food wasn't bad. Service was a little slow but not terrible but the wait for the food took soooooooo long. If you have time sure go there but if you ain't willing to wait don't...
Not so good. Would have much rather gone to chilis. Got the "Really good cheeseburger", it was not.

Goodbye to our favorite family friendly restaurant. Called in tonight in advance for reservations because I have 5 kids and need to work around their patience and bedtimes. We were told no reservations allowed for less than 8. I still proceeded and it was the worst dinner experience of my life; not because I was treated the worst, but because it made me feel like nothing.  This is my restaurant, I should expect the same whether its my husband or I, or me and my 5 kids. We couldn't get a refill, our ketchup was empty, 1 hour + seated and still only had the kids entrees out ( which were ordered with the drinks). The waitress never bothered to clear our menus, or the empty cups when I flagged for a refill, no kidding the whole time we never even got flatware. Never once did she even say how are you guys doing, she knew what she was doing. Kids finished their food and still the 3 adult entrees I ordered still never came even once I asked for a manager. I have had good experiences here in the past, but there is nothing that stings a parent harder than seeing obvious discrimination because you are at a kid table. Manager comped the kids meals but I don't think he understands...Going out to eat with 5 kids is expensive and exhausting but I did it for the experience. It is not the money, it's the fact that we are ignored and your server turned something that was supposed to be family fun into something stressful. A mom like me is your perfect table, we want in and out and yeah..some extra ketchup.

I know they have always had poor food but I thought it has been a few years maybe they made some improvements. Wow was I wrong.  I ordered the french dip. When I got my food I looked at it and was oh no this will be bad. The food tasted like it was on the shelf for a few months then cooked it and gave it to me. The fries seemed like they sat for a long time too. I just don't get why people keep going here. The quality of this food is and from my last visit bad! A large fail here guys. Management should really look at the quality of thier food and change some things.

I will give it a 2 star because I like the beers and the appetizers. Been to this location a handful of times at night around 10:00pm. The service has always been slow and slower at times. The bartenders are the watiresses so if they are stuck behind the bar they don't have time to tend to your table. Obviously the owners don't care about all the bad service reviews on how slow it is. Anyways I do like TGIF just not this place. There are others ones that have great service and actual waiters.

I came to this location. "Temecula" the bar area is open seating my family and I sat for about 20 mins and no one came to help us finally the host came over only to tell us to getout of the both because even though it's in the bar area it's not open seating worst place I've even been to

Service was atrocious. The bartender was supposed to be taking care of 6 of us in the meeting room. Took forever to get drinks and take orders, took 40 minutes to bring out checks, never came to pick up checks, we had to walk them up to the bar. When we tried to register a complaint with the bartender, he never apologized, started complaining about the manager, going into internal restaurant issues. We asked to be treated like any other tables in the restaurant. He complained we weren't billing $100.00 in the meeting room. Dude, if we weren't there, your meeting room would've been empty. This lunch group is tbere every Friday. You don't deserve their business. Just because we're 10 feet further away through one door. I usually tip 20% on full bill including tax. Hope you enjoy the two cents.

Went here on a wednesday night. As Friday's has always tired to do, they're blasting music, attempted to create a dace floor, and carding at the door. I thought this was a chain restaurant that i can just go to the bar, be carded and enjoy mild music and some drinks. So here's my experience... I enter, no one at the door, cool, so i walk in (with a friend) straight to the bar. Only 3 barstools left that i could see, so we take two of them. We proceed to order our drinks, but after we are asked if we have wristbands. Friend and i look at one another confused, so i try to ask where to get said wristband but could not hear the lady over the obnoxious music. So after that she just continues with the well and completely ignored us like we were fucking stupid. Go back towards the host stand to see where we were supposedly to get the wrist bands.. Of course now there's two security guards, or whatever they're supposed to be called. Asked them if they're the ones providing the wristbands. Of course they were. But we told them it was funny that no one was up front when we first entered. Security didnt seem to understand and just proceeded to tell us that we have to be 21 or over to be in the bar. NO SHIT DUDE!! We just didnt know it was card at the door cause none of you were there up front to take our IDs. Anyway, we both only had one drink each and left after dealing with all that. Would have stayed for at least a few more drinks and definitely food if we felt a bit more welcomed. Peace Fridays! Endless apps wont even bring me back.

I went for lunch yesterday and it was a horrible experience! It took 45min for us to get our food. There was nobody there except a couple of other parties, so I'm not sure what took so long. The menus were sticky and the bathroom smelled AWFUL! You could smell it through the entire restaurant whenever someone opened the bathroom door.  I ordered the chicken club and it didn't have chicken on it (when it finally arrived). The fries tasted a day old and rubbery with too much salt. It was the worst lunch I've ever had. The only good part was our waitress. She was very kind, but as a whole, the restaurant was horrible and I won't be returning.

I came here on labor & the service was very good but sloooooooow. Our waiter did just great, our problem was not with her but with the kitchen staff & how long we had to wait for our food.We waited about 15 min to get seated, then waited about 10 min before our server came around taking our drink orders. Which by then was after 7 so we just barely missed happy hour because of that. So we ordered our food right away when we placed the drink orders. It took nearly 45 minutes for us to get our food! We didn't order anything crazy just a burger,quesadilla,and fish&chips. We were about to cancel our order but we had already been waiting 30 min by that point so we toughed it out. We finally get our food which was just meh & I have any dipping sauce for my fish so I asked for ranch... That was another 20 min wait just for that! I didn't get it until I got up & asked the hostess in the from if she could help me out. We were clearly not pleased with the service which the server could tell & did apologize for it. I spoke to a manager who apologized & gave us a discount. She also said there were only TWO cooks working. You guys need to get it together& either hire more people or work on getting food out to customers faster.

Mehhhhh.....stopped here to grab some munchies on 10/31/15, after doing some quick shopping. Haven't been to this location in years, actually had my first date with my hubby here so we thought why not. Place still looks good, staff was friendly and it was cool to see them dressed up for Halloween. We got the Jack Daniels sampler, hubby got the Chicken Cobb Salad and I got some clam chowder. Sampler was yummy, though plates would of been nice because it was nice and freshly hot. Clam Chowder was gross, I only took one bite and that was enough. It didn't even taste like clam chowder, it was sour and had a really odd after taste. I sent it back and got a house salad instead. Hubby's salad was OK but, usually the items in a Cobb are chopped well the Chicken was like chunks and not bite sized chunks either. We also ordered the Tennessee Whiskey Cake, which was really good. Our waitress Ashley was very nice and comped the salad, which was very nice of her, as well as taking the chowder off our ticket. That's the only other reason we gave this place a star, besides the dessert.  Pretty much will not go back, quality does not match the price at all. Basically it was $50, for a sampler, a coke, ice tea, Cobb Salad and dessert. I'm willing to pay for quality not mediocrity. Save your money.

After giving this T.G.I. Friday's a chance a couple of times, I was so close to giving it two stars, maybe even three because of surprisingly good service from a server who actually might have been a manager, but my most recent visit proved to me that this location may not deserve to be a dining option in Temecula.  Yes, they have endless appetizers, and yes, they have Jack Daniel's sauce (they skimp on it though), and yes, they even have really good Happy Hour drink and appetizer specials that extend through the night during football season. I'll give them that. But the service...the service here ruins the dining experience, as it would anywhere. The last time I came for Happy Hour, the bartender who served me was either in a bad mood or poorly trained in customer service. It seemed like ordering was inconveniencing him somehow, and twice he came back to tell me I had to order something else because the beer I asked for from the menu wasn't in stock at the restaurant. The food came out okay, but nothing was enticing me to stay.  Not long after I got my check, there was some kind of ruckus going on at the front of the bar near the kitchen and that bartender was yelling at another server about customers. Not just raising his voice, but shouting at her with very animated gestures while she tried to calmly take it. I'm not sure what it was about, but whatever the issue was should have been handled elsewhere and not out in the open for customers to witness. It was very unprofessional and surely made people uncomfortable. I did not stick around to see how management handled the situation, but if they can't keep employees from exhibiting this kind of behavior, then they need to restructure or not be in business. I do not plan to come back.
We waited 20 minutes with no one helping whatsoever as people came and orders before us. Dj was playing loud obnoxious music, we left and no one even noticed

Check out their happy hour as their food and drinks are super cheap. Their happy hours runs in the afternoon till 7 pm and sone nights from 10 pm to midnight.  Their service is usually good but sometimes can be a little slow. I love their Jack Daniels sauce. Yummy  If they worked on their service this location would def be a 5star restaurant.

Had a late dinner there tonight. My husband and I ordered the endless apps! Major disaster on all accounts! Took forever to get a server, first order of potato skins and pot stickers arrived finally and the skins are cold! Send them back, order barbecue chicken wings and meatballs. They come before the redone skins come out. Guess cold is there specialty because the chickens wings come out.... you guessed it cold. So now we are at 50%  bad, the skins finally show up...aannnnd they are cold, yep cold. Manager came over and kind of tried to excuse it and say it was warm, no no my friend, cold. Do not eat here if you want hot food!

Been frequenting this location lately.  I have been on a lobster and rib kick, and this place is a great place for it.  They service this time was great.  Our waitress was training someone and she was doing a great job, very friendly.  Even better I had a coupon for buy one seafood entree and get one free, SCORE!  The restaurant is always clean and I haven't experienced waiting to be seated.  I like the tvs in the bar area, and people with families, don't feel intimidated with sitting in a bar area with kids, this location has large booths to sit in and its perfect for keeping the kids entertained.  They have a nice dessert menu also.  Very happy with  my visit.  Seems they have stepped up there game this past few months.

10/10 my service has been amazing!!!! 10:30 on a Friday at Friday's is definitely a busy time and Alice has been a wonderful lady! She definitely knows her stuff & is extremely warm and personable. My husband and I are definitely impressed and are coming back
Poor poor service! We sat down and got unlimited appetizers and got only 1 refill in 2 hours!!When we got the food it wasn't even hot! Very slow service!

Just walked out of Tgi Fridays Temecula. My husband and I walked in and waited in front to be greeted and seated. And waited... and waited... and waited. A few waitresses walked by and didn't acknowledge us at all.  So we sat outselves in the bar area. Then some snotty girl comes over (right away) and says (very sarcastically) "Um... in the future this isn't a self seating area" I tried to tell her we had been waiting a long time but she rolled her eyes and stomped off. We left before my husband blew a gasket. Unbelievable!!

We went in for lunch to celebrate a milestone event.  It's Friday, so here we are!  Carla gave us fantastic service.... Not only did she prove to have a phenomenal memory (she didn't write our order down), but she served us with a smile.  Our black bean burger and the potato skins (ordered without cheese and bacon) were awesome, as was the oreo dessert.  Love the location, too.  Just plain can't beat this place and am glad we chose the right place to raise our glasses!
Worst food ever. Food was not cooked right at all, I ordered a lobster tail and I got a burnt tail

Went this past weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. It was DELICIOUS. My husband and I had a great time as well. Husband had the endless apps and I had the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta... So good!! We will definitely be back
One word .. GROSS!! The cook seriously needs a new job . Mashed potatoes were hard as a rock shrimp tastes like old grease .. Rotten lettuce in the burgers . I'll never go back

Upon arriving this place wasn't that busy. We seated ourselves at the bar area. I ordered a vodka and ginger ale and they messed that up and gave me vodka and water. Sean who was our server didn't apologize for their mistake. We were about to order and Sean said before u order just letting you know we ran out of the boneless chicken and beef tostadas that were on the happy hour menu. I asked Sean since we drove 40 minutes just to eat their happy hour menu of the wings and tostadas (we should have went to Riverside Friday's) I wanted the bone in chicken at the happy hour special. He asked his manager Junior and Junior said no! Well Junior you should have accommodated us in some way shape or form due to your lack of good management and apologized about my drink and running out of food. This place has a 2 stars and now I know why!!! You need to get trained on how to run a restaurant and learn when it's the restaurants fault u need to make the customers experience better!

So despite the horrible reviews that I have read about this TGI Fridays my husband and I decided to check it out because we had a gift card. We went on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty except a few other diners. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip with chips to start and the dip was delish! I ordered the petite steak and salmon and my husband had the steak fajitas. We were both very satisfied with the portions and the quality. The service was also very attentive and we really had no complaints. We are assuming new management or they are trying to bring back up their reviews; either way it was a good evening and would go back if we were in the area!

Honestly a disappointing experience. Our bartender seemed unorganized & blatantly ignored us. We ordered a couple drinks and about 20 mins later we got them... Ordered food & received the wrong order.  Got the right item finally, but it was wrong once again. She disappeared probably not even half way through our time there. The only pleasant reason for our service was a bartender Shawn (hope I'm spelling that right) he definitely seemed a bit overwhelmed. But he came through & saved our orders. Apologized & honestly made it a not so irking experience. Thanks Shawn! TGIF, get it together. Be more likeShawn. Remember that customer service is a large part of bringing back customers.

First time back since my last review. I might say they did a 360 turn-around! We actually got drinks, menu and food in a good amount of time unlike before! I was really impressed with our server, I believe her name was Sierra, she was constantly checking on our table. Everyone seemed to enjoy their plates. The only complain I have is they charge you $2.49 for a "Happy Birthday" song and sundae! Wow I always thought that was complimentary but maybe it's something new or I never noticed the fee before.
Naomi, Amber, and Tara!! Omg!! I feel like they are family!!!! I cannot express just how much fun we are having! And the food is delicious!! They are family!!!

First off let me just say that I am a server. I am not a server at TGI FRIDAYS in Temecula, but elsewhere. I know that when a family comes in 9 times out of 10 they want their children's meal first. That 1 person that doesn't would probably like and respect the option of being able to do so. With that being said, I went in TGIF tonight with my son and his friends and my girl friend. We ordered our kids food and told the waitress, Jazmin, it's best she put their order in because once we get food in front of them they would stop being so rambunctious. After she took the boys order she came to take our order later which when she came to the table she told us our kids food was up she just needed to Deliver it. She waited until after she took our order, waited for us to get someone to bring out kids food out, and for the rest of our order to be DONE BEFORE delivering our kids food. We were so upset. Next time a mom orders their kids meals before hand... please bring it as soon as it is ready. Thank you, sincerely this momma.

The worst service I've ever received at any restaurant. I came here a few times before with some coworkers after we get off work at 11:00pm. We got here around 11:20, NOT BUSY at all. Saw a busser guy and girl just standing there talking. We waited to get seated, but after waiting about 15 minutes, I got impatient and we sat ourselves down at a table near them so they would acknowledge us. They saw us but just kept on talking. We sat there for 10 more minutes and the girl finally came up to us. She said "Let me find you a server, I don't think we have one for these tables over here." I said ok and she left for a while again. She got back to the table and said "The kitchen actually closed at 11:45" and went back to talking to that bus boy again. Lol really? All the times I've been here before, ALWAYS at this time, they've always served us and let us know, a little before 1am, that the kitchen is closing and if we needed anything else. How are you open 'til 2am and close the kitchen 2 1/2 hours before?

The first thing we noticed when walking in is the smell. It smelled muggy like it needed ventilation. The place is dark and old. It is in need of a remodel. I ordered the two items off the grill special. I got the ribs and 6oz steak, with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. First of all they took 40 minutes to bring us our food. When I got my food there was so much grease on the plate that my mashed potatoes observed it all. The mashed potatoes were plain no taste no seasoning. The Mac and cheese was over cooked and soggy no seasoning. The ribs were ok but they had very little bbq sauce the steak was extremely greasy. Overall the food was mediocre definitely not worth the price. The one thing we liked were the drinks. Other than that this place needs new recipes and a remodel for sure. Oh and the drinks even though they were good, heads up they are very expensive 12.50 for a Grey goose vodka lemonade and 9 for a strawberry hurricane. I recommend chillis better food cleaner and better service

Wanted to go here for lunch today. Walked in, no one waiting, only a few people seated. Told there was a 30 min wait.  Thought they were kidding, but they weren't.  Lack of customers, tons of empty tables AND a 30 minute wait.  Walked out, will not be returning!!!

Absolutely terrible service. It sucked, the food was mediocre at best. 20 minutes to sit for lunch, hostess running around clueless. Waitress serving my food and having my wife's come up 15 minutes later. There was barely no one here. Very very sad this place has turned to one of the worst rated places to eat around the mall. You would think they should clear house or get some better training. Waitress was nice but seemed way to busy, my wife's mahi sat under a heat lamp for 20 minutes. No team work. Disgusted. Hopefully they close this place down and open something worth stopping in for lunch!

TGI Fridays has a great lunch menu at pretty good prices but the service is HORRIBLE. I've been a server in my past life so I always give servers some slack, but this was ridiculous. My coworkers and I went yesterday for lunch. There was only one person waiting tables and the wait was 15-20 minutes. There were only 3 tables being served!  So we opted for the bar seating. That turned out to be just as bad and we were the only table to be served. Meals came out wrong, never got refills on our drinks and had to hunt our checks down, then hunt for our server to bring the change/credit cards back. I don't see this place staying open much longer.

Always a fan of Friday's for their great prices especially on their steaks that are cooked so well! I typically sit at the bar but today I dined in, our server Sadie was awesome! She was so friendly! Be back soon (:
Lag.      25 mins for a beer. My whole section is now empty and still waiting on my beer.  Apparently it takes 3 people to clean a table.   I'm pissed

Don't get me wrong. I LOVE TGI Fridays. I love their drinks, apps, entrees, dessert...everything is always good. Unfortunately, this specific location does not meet the standards of other Friday's I've been to. I went to dinner twice this month at this location, and both times the service has been meh. It's very awkward to walk in and see the hostesses and bus boy talking about their personal lives, laughing, while my boyfriend and I are waiting for a table. This happened the first time we came in and when the hostess took us to our table, the table was extremely wet and sticky. We dismissed this because they must have just cleaned it. Whatever. Then it took about 15 minutes for our waitress to approach us, but she ended up being very nice so it was fine. We got the endless apps, and I always love them. However, the potato skins have gone down hill. They used to be crispy and delicious, but now I can tell they've just been frozen and microwaved! Not good. This dinner was an overall okay experience. The waitress definitely made it better. The second time we went this month was awful! We waited like 15 minutes for a table, while the bus boy was talking with a waitress, AGAIN, about his personal life. It wasn't busy because it was around 11pm and waitresses had to ASK the bus boy to clean up a table for us. He took forever that we ended up leaving and went to Yard House instead. ADVICE TO THE MANAGER: FIRE THE BUS BOY. He's the really tall guy with the black hair and beard. He SUCKS at his job, clearly.

Stopped in on a Friday, late afternoon, with my husband. There was a 10 minute wait for a table in the dining room, so we opted to sit at a table in the bar area. We had a couple of glasses of wine and 3 appetizers. Both the service and food were excellent!

Once again amazing! food was good our server was very friendly. He was quick with our drinks and food came just a little after. checked in on us quite a bit but not too where it was annoying. Cant remember his name but he was great! Happy Hour deals are the best! all day sunday!

They took forever to get the first order of endless apps out to us! Then even longer for the second round! It's fried food not rocket science. Poured water it the lap of the kids.. Needless to say, it's reduced the perception of this place to just another bar. We haven't been there in a while, but we won't be back even longer!! Thanks for the 2 hour visit and one round of food

I'm not usually one to write reviews on restaurants but this restaurant was the worst I'd ever been to. My family recently went here on my brothers birthday & it was a completely horrible experience. Our waitress literally took about 10-15 min to greet us and take our order. I ordered an appetizer (some breadsticks) and it never even came out until about 30-40 minutes later (after our food even came out). We told the manger about how it'd had been going for us while we were there she said she'd come back to bring us more of the endless appetizers, she never came back. Throughout the entire time we were there our server visited the table no more than 3 times, no refills were given to anyone, yet the restaurant was basically empty all around. We've been to other TGIF restaurants before & our experience was nothing like this. Definitely won't be returning nor recommending anyone else to go there.
Average. Small portions, cold food.  Upcharge for tiny salad?  Slow service.  Not how fridays used to be.

My husband came here to order a salad for myself and a mac and cheese for my son. He sat at the bar ordered a beer and the food. 50 minutes later he wrote a note that he understands it wasn't the bartenders fault and took off.

Terrible food, terrible service, terrible price. Food was cold and in very small servings. Dirty floors and servers, table was dirty which makes no sense because the place was empty. Next time I'd rather get a microwave dinner. At least there I can service myself.

Wait wasn't too bad until we got seated. We ordered an appetizer along with our meal but figured the appetizer would come out first. It did not. We were almost finished with our meal and decided what was the point, we cancelled it and left. Staff was nice and apologetic towards the kitchen which I think thats where the problem is. Our food wasn't too amazing, our fries tasted as though they sat out for awhile and the lettuce on our hamburgers were wilted. I just kept thinking it was an overpriced chilis, but then again, i would of had a better experience if we had gone to chilis.
Wasn't worth it. Burgers came out greasy and soggy. Came at a time where they weren't even busy.

Worst experience I have ever had eating out. Service was very slow. They sat us and we had to wait 10 minutes till a server showed up. At that time we placed our complete order. The app got dropped off a few min later. Then we had to wait another 25 min till our burger showed up from a food runner who did not remove the app plate. The fries were cold. At that time we asked for our check and took forever to get check and then no one came back to collect payment so we had to take it to the bar where they then sent 3 ppl out to find our waitress. If the restaurant was full I could understand but it was empty with only a few tables full.

Went here on Christmas at the request of my kids who love the endless apps.  We arrived to be told there would be a 20 min wait for a table; we had driven 45min to get here (we kinda live in the sticks) so I needed to visit the men's room.  I walked through one of the main sections in the restaurant; of the 12 tables, 7 were either empty or needed busing because the guests had left; the next section over (this would be half the restaurant) was the same-less tables occupied than empty.  I understand not having the staff to seat all your tables and avoiding bad service, but you would think that Christmas is kind of a traditionally busy day for places that are open and a well managed place would be prepared. Restroom was tossed-no need to go further there. We were seated in 15 min, so they did well there; although it took the server being "summoned" with the tablet on the table to bring menus.  This is where things started to go off the rails.  There was no mention of the promotion in their weird new menus, nor was there a menu on the table for the endless apps promo.  After a few minutes of waiting on her to come back (did not see her "serving" either, just MIA - Female manager hanging out in drink station "observing" and doing nothing as well; we "summoned" the server via the button again.  She came by and I asked about the endless app promo.  She confirmed the promo was live and promptly went into an explanation as to "how busy" the kitchen was (again less than half tables occupied) and that it would be more than 20 min between "app refills"; and suggested we order something else off the menu-and pointed out that if we wanted apps we should just order them off the menu because they were half priced?  I asked if she meant every time we ordered more chicken or pizza or whatever it would be atleast 20 min and she confirmed.  I said "welp that is what we came for, you guys seem to be having some issues, I guess we will be leaving" and we got up and left. The whole POINT of apps in a restaurant is that they are supposed to take little effort for the kitchen to push out; and if you have a promo like this, you would think they would have someone on the app station full time to keep them rolling out.  To then suggest ordering them off the menu is a terrible suggestion if for whatever reason they are having trouble getting them out-you just backed up your already messed up line more. I hate having to post a negative review for any business, I understand the hardships of people calling off etc; but to put so much money and effort into promoting a special that you try to drive people away from, and to see a manager "chilling" for over 5 min while the staff was allegedly overwhelmed, perplexed me.  Usually in the restaurant industry your manager is cappable of jumping in and helping in the kitchen if they are needed; and obviously should be able to help the wait staff. I know the server probably assumed we were looking for a "cheap" option and were not likely to tip well but she was wrong-we wound up at our local JITB and had such a fantastic experience there we tipped the person who served us $10-I mean heck it was Christmas!

My family and I walked into TGIF FRIDAYS tonight and was seated almost immediately as they were not very busy. As soon as we were seated, we were promptly ignored for over 10 minutes. I had a family of 4 plus a baby and figured it would be a nice check for them as well as a decent tip based on the projected bill to feed us all. After waiting more than 10 minutes and getting not so much as eye contact from any of the staff we decided to leave and took our business next door to Karl Strauss where they are all too happy to take our money - so much that they even payed attention to us and prepared us a good meal as well - go figure? I feel bad for the owner or whoever pays the bills for that place (FRIDAYS) - shame on the manger for allowing us to get up and walk out (taking our time mind you, to try and draw attention) without even aknowledging us, but they could'nt have cared less as no one even spoke to us as we left....... We used to enjoy this TGIF FRIDAYS Key words: USED TO...................

Today I came in to try the dine and drink for 12$ and man all I can say is the item choices on the menu is phenomenal. I tried the Jack Daniels Mahi Mahi and man they put their heart into it.. Please go try the menu it's only 12$. The staff tonight was tremendously awesome. Holly the manager is such a great manager. Please go try the menu it is to die for.. Janelle, Ashley, Armardo and Amber was very helpful in my choice tonight.. Go see them they will take care of you..

What you expect from a fridays. I ate here with a girlfriend and we were seated right away in a booth close to the bar...nice. our waitress was super friendly and the food tasted good also. Only thing was my friend was given the wrong side, however; they fixed it right away and didnt give attitude about it either so that was nice. Like most fridays the decor is fun and wild. I had a mojito with my lunch which tasted delicious also. Ill definitely be returning.

This is terrible.  We got here 20 minutes before happy hour.  The place was slow.  There were only 2 tables open, because the rest weren't clean.  It took 10 minutes before someone asked if we wanted a drink.  We've been here 20 minutes more now and non of the tables are bussed.  I normally love TGI Fridays but I sure as hell won't be back here when Karl Strause is next door and they're on top of their shit.

When my best friend and I can't figure out where we wanna go to eat, we sometimes fall back on this place and it never fails!  Staff is friendly, waiting time is fairly short, and the 2 for $20 deal is the best for couples, we get it every single time! Either way, an excellent place to eat late at night :)
It was ok, they are understaffed and our food was not cooked well. Our server was fabulous and did the best job she could so we gave her a nice tip.  She was set-up for failure. Won't be back.

This is by far the worst TGIF's ever. We sat down and our waitress didn't even come to serve us until 15 minutes after we sat down. Our food was absolutely terrible and it was cold. I sent the food back because it was cold and never got it back. Then she came back and never even commented on it. We grabbed out check and left. Didn't tip. Do not come here.

Terrible! Terrible! Terrrrriiibblllleee service and food! Never again! By the time we got our food it was cold. Our server didn't even pay attention to us. Sipping on one glass of water the whole time we were there. SHE never says thank you or your welcome and she just drops our food and our bill and again no thank you! How rude! Happy hour here is terrible!!! Here's a tip "DONT TIP"

This is the worst Friday's I've ever been to.  Stay away from Temecula's Friday's.  The food is very bad and served cold. The service is extremely slow and the restaurant is dirty. My husband and my son had a bad experience with bad food a year ago but decided to give this location another try. My son and I got our food and we were both done eating before my husband received his food. The fries were greasy and cold. We told the server who said she would get the manager to replace it.  She never did. The server told us in frustration, that the manager didn't want to make fresh fries and she has been fighting with her.  We paid a lot of money for bad food  Never coming here again.  It's definitely a problematic location.

I used to work at this location and I can honestly say it can be more than trying to do so. That being said, I came in last week and had dinner with my family and it was amazing. I think that a major issue with tgi Fridays is their promotion for endless apps (when this began is when I left). The whole idea does nothing but stress out their staff and slow down their whole production. The same side of the kitchen that makes your before dinner salad is the same side of the kitchen that sends out half of your refill apps. As a former server there I can say that the reason you are not getting your refill sodas or FaceTime with your server is most likely because they are in the kitchen desperately trying to get an eta to get food out for either your table or another one seated around you. Working at a restaurant that runs these types of promotions is a thankless job but more often than not they are doing their very best.

NEVER AGAIN ! Not so good service. Worst TGIF I have ever been to. Went  with wife, not impressed.  Artichoke dip was okay, but wings weren't done all the way. Waitress took forever and never brought my refill. When she asked if it was 'time for dessert?' I said, ",It's time to go." Like I said, never again. Didn't tip.

Excellent Service!!! Our Waiter Was Sean.. He Was Beyond Awesome .. My Family And I Had The Unlimited Appetizers (Came Out Fast And Delish) The Jack Daniel Chicken And Shimp Was Sooooooo Good!! Great Way To End Our Sunday Funday!! Thank You Fridays.. You Rock Sean!!!

HORRIBLE SERVICE !!!!  ... Place is either under staffed or not optimized for 3 groups of people showing up at the same time. We waited 10 minutes for the hostess to set up seating for 2 groups of 7-8 people. Let me start by saying this place sucks all the way around! Food suck and service suck! Took forever for food and it came out like it was microwaved! Yuck never again!

I have to say I went in for endless apps with my family . The only thing that was good was my boneless wings and the beer was warm . The chicken strip were Blah . I won't be revisiting this establishment again . And the service was bad .

Never,Ever going here again ,all pre packaged and they can't even warm up chicken all cold ,hamburgers small and processed as well and service took over 1 hour and we were first service at 11 am today.Time to change management and staff no leadership.I took 1 bite of sour Cesar salad and gave it back no one from management came to see what my concerns were.Typical for service.

Worst service ever. Runner brings food out and doesn't ask if we need anything else. Had to take my coke glass to bar for a refill. The fish and chips is awful. It stunk. Really gone down hill from years ago. Had to find someone to take my bill. Awful

So I did the dumb thing of being so busy I didn't realize I didn't get dinner for Christmas so the family and I decided to go out to eat.. Good food! I enjoyed it. Good service and food came out quick. The salmon and langoustine was good but not worth $20. The Sizzling Chicken and Shrimp with Parmesan garlic fries were great! Great value.

Got here at 11:08 Sunday. They open at 11, I have 4 in my party and we ordered right away, salad and soup, a cheese burger, French dip and child's grilled cheese. At 11:55 I got my salad. I come here every week for rotary and receive great service! Today, I ordered and did not receive my food. CUSTOMERS BEWARE!!!! If you eat here you may get food poisoning or DIE!!!!! This is the absolute most horrible TJI Fridays I have ever been to!!! Had we read the reviews, we would have seen that this TJI Fridays only had 2 stars!!!! HORRIBLE RESTAURANT, HORRIBLE REVIEWS, HORRIBLE FOOD, HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! CUSTOMERS BEWARE!!!! They could kill people by serving rotten seafood! DO NOT EAT HERE!!!! 0 STARS! 0 STARS! 0 STARS!

Went for a long over due Happy hour with coworkers tonight and was completely disappointed!!  The service was slow, our poor waiter was the slash bartender and had his hands full.  He was great but had no help, which left our table full of dirty plates and cups.  He was great and needs a raise!!  I also find it unprofessional when another server had her young daughter at work in the beverage area and the hostess took care of her in between orders  Happy hour beer selection is generic,nothing special!  All eight of us agreed we will not be returning!

First time to TGI Fridays in awhile.  It's really gone downhill. Brought the family here to Celebrate Mother's Day...the highlights: 1) Food quality was pretty bad  Kids spaghetti was the worst I've ever tasted (no wonder my daughter wouldn't touch it).  Recipe for the potato wedges has clearly changed, and it's gross. Wow, it has been awhile since I checked their Yelp status! I'm still perplexed as to the MANY, MANY, negative reviews. Since my original review we have been back a few times and I have NEVER experienced the negativity noted in these reviews. I still hold that this has been one of the better "chain restaurants" we occasionally go to. Our latest trip here was just before New Years. Our food was excellent, cooked perfectly (with the exception that some of the Au Juis was spilled on the plate and over-moistened the bottom bun - but not to the point the wife sent it back) and our server (Athena) was excellent. Very attentive, personable and engaging (not to the point of annoyance). Luck of the draw on our parts I guess, as we have not experienced the negativity being noted on these pages; and I can be opinionated at times. Sad...
Food was not all that great. The presentation was great but the food didn't have much flavor. I rated it a four cause service was great and I got the 2 for 20 deal  so I didn't expect the best.

I went to Fridays a few months back and sat at the bar.  I was there for about 7-8 minutes and still had not been greeted.  They weren't busy at all and the two bartenders were just chatting among themselves ignoring the bar.  So I left and went somewhere else.   I thought of going again and that maybe I just caught them on an off day.   I went in yesterday afternoon (Thursday) at about 5pm.  The coke in my cocktail was flat and the food took about 30 minutes to come which is super slow considering the place was empty.  When I asked for a different drink, it seemed like I was bothering the bartender.  He then got in a loud argument with a customer which I thought was very unprofessional.  Its obvious that the staff here doesn't enjoy what they do... very unfriendly!  After two bad experiences, I'm done. On a side note, try Rodrigo's for happy hour.  We went there after Fridays and got great service and awesome $3 margaritas.  That's my new spot.
Great time. Great food. Great service from Amber. Girl is full of personality. Perfect food for the healthy minded people.
On the way from San Diego.  The restaurant was empty but we were told 45 minute wait... Guess they don't want our business

"It's Friday, Friday...gotta get down on Friday...Getting ready for the weekend, weekend!" :-) So yeah, I actually work at this location...but my review is totally non-biased! Trust me! The service is spot on (not always; but tonight it was).  Our server (Aizza) was very nice and attentive. She brought us our drinks and our appetizer (pretzels and beer cheese sauce - with an extra side of ranch for my son). The pretzels were fresh from the kitchen and perfectly salted and buttered. Four big soft pretzels - two for me, two for my son. My son ordered the 6oz petite sirloin with a side of mashed potatoes and seasoned fries. Perfectly cooked sirloin (medium well) topped with maison butter. My son enjoyed it a lot! The mashed potatoes he devoured first though. Really hot (temperature) and tasty (according to him!) I ordered the new All American Stacked Burger! Holy moly! I've never had this item before tonight - and was immediately impressed! Two 3.6oz fresh beef patties, grilled and stacked on  leaf lettuce, sliced tomato, pickles, and 1,000 Island dressing with melty cheese and two strips of peppered bacon (We back our bacon with fresh coarse black pepper) all on a soft brioche bun! Yum! I chose a small house salad with ranch as my side. Everything was fresh and delicious! Aizza refilled our beverages promptly. She continued to check in on us, even as the restaurant started becoming busy with the dinner rush... Side note: Appetizers are half priced at various times (happy hour times). Also, all day Sunday, during football season, appetizers are half priced too!

Food was great. Service was on point. No complaints except its a little dark. But on the downside there wasnt anything spectacular that made it stand out from any other restaraunt in the area. But ill give my 4 stars

This was my second time here in the last month. Was there with a large group and both times were the same. Extremely slow service and upwards of an hour wait for our food to arrive. I know large groups can slow things down but 2+ hours to get in and out are unacceptable. The food portions are a joke and the food quality is bland to put it nicely. The servers seem to act like we're interrupting their hanging out with their friends. Way too many better options nearby to go back.

Absolutely love it here! Happy hour all day Sunday's with half price appetizers all over the restaurant not just in the bar, $5 ultimate lemonades.   Great service all the time, even when they are super busy, their service is quick and I have never had an order messed up. Have celebrated 21st birthdays there a bunch of times, mine, my friends, my siblings.. awesome atmosphere and reasonably priced drinks. Love when they run specials like 2 for 10 (an appetizer or dessert and an entree) or 2 people eat 3 courses for 20 (one appetizer, 2 entrees and a dessert) yumm. Great meal options, steak, chicken, fish, pasta, salads and sandwiches, huge drink menu a full page of appetizers.  Just all around love this spot, come here at least once a month, great for groups too. They never have a problem doing separate checks for everyone at the table, Ive gone with groups from just me and one other to tables of 25 on the patio area.  Go here, its fun, cheap and delicious.

We went into the bar on a Saturday night 7:00 PM as most everywhere else was packed. When you go here expect bar food ,not gourmet. The food is OK and the drinks were better. The service was pretty awesome. Chris was very cool and attentive.We go just for drinks and appetizers typically. We will go back when we want some apps and a quick drink or 2.

Walked in, greeted by a friendly hostess, seated in a booth immediately & offered water & menus by server immediately!

HORRIBLE TERRIBLE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!   Server was the slowest server ever.  We were there at lunch for 90 minutes.  Ridiculous!  Took forever to get a waiter, get drinks, order, get food, get check.  Very painful experience.  Got our food in stages and without key items ... breadsticks w/o cheese sauce, fries w/o garlic parmesan, soup w/o spoon.  Clam chowder was cold on one side, warm on the other, and veggies were crunchy.  My friend ordered garlic parmesan fries, but got regular, so he packed the right ones to go but they were swimming in butter.  I never got my salad, so he packed it to go with the dressing on it! I went here for a Friday lunch, after saving some coupons that had came in the mail. They were buy one get one free.
