Shout out to Jessica for taking care of us in the bar area for dinner. Rye Old-Fashions were great. Reasonable prices for decent food. I had the Jack Daniel's grill with the 6 oz steak and chicken, mashed potatoes and Mac & Cheese. Shared the brownie obsession with Wifey. We both enjoyed the dessert - even though we were full... Will go back.

Haven't been to this location in about three years and I wish I didn't come back. the hostess is the only thing that saves this review from being a 1 star. simply put...our food was delivered in the completely wrong order (1 entrée, appetizer, my childs food, salad, second entrée) and every plate except for my sons plate was cold. my wife's ribs were dry, her fries cold and the plate presentation seemed rushed. my burger and all its garnishes were cold and the bottom bun was beyond soggy, denoting that it had sit for a long time...somewhere. while our waitress apologized for the inconvenience (though we heard her apologize to other tables for incorrect orders) as did the manager, no attempt was made to make up for the mistakes. none what-so-ever and that is what really irks me. for shame Fridays...did you loss your all-star service to the new Karl Strauss?

This place was awful... The restroom was dirty. The soda had an awful taste. They messed up our order and the waitress had a bad attitude... I would never go back here. We ended up walking out and not eating out food because of the lack of service and how nasty the burger and waitress were. Don't go here unless you like rude people...

Just okay .... It took a long time to get our food, especially considering that 2 people in our party of 5 got salads. The others in our party only got appetizers as their meal. It took over 30 minutes to get our food, and we were the first customers they had for the day (so the restaurant was practically empty). The food was good, and the service was okay. It wasn't an experience that would compel me to return.

Went this afternoon for lunch before heading to the mall and I have to admit it was the worse experience I've ever had. Not only did people that walked in after us got served before us my chicken wings were served burnt, no drink refills were offered. No intention was made to offer me anything else. Our waiter kept attending other tables but ours. It took 30 minutes for our food to arrive plus our waiter looked like he was forced to go to work after a long night out from the previous night. I made sure to have him take the wings back and not to leave him a tip.

wowooooooo, hadnt eaten here in a while. what happened? i think the $14 burger i ordered had been preserved for a couple of years. the bun turned to dust, and the patty was petrified. aged, rock like. couldn't eat it and would not pay for it. feel for the servers at this store. this store is a sinking ship, stay away and live...

I went here for lunch & ordered a chicken caesar salad & artichoke dip. Wow, what a joke. The dressing on the salad reminded me of middle school salad dressing. It was overpriced & barely any salad!!! With regards to the artichoke dip, it was bland and the chips were stale! This is unforgivable. The service was also less then satisfactory. Never again will this restaurant be graced with my presence even if it's the last place on earth!

Surprised at the slow service.  Kitchen was more than off today.  Ordered ribs and shrimp, 35 minute ticket wait.  Food was warm, fries were both cold and hard, as if they had been sitting in a tray.  Asked for hot fries.  Fifteen minutes later we finally went to ask for our check.  Fries were just coming out.  Refused the fries.  Not hungry anymore.  Lunch has always been great, will pass on having dinner there again.  :(

I went in for a few drinks and appetizers with friends. The endless appetizers were a joke. We sat at the bar and bar tender was good, but service was slow. We tried 4 items between the 2 of us and they were all horrible! Potato skins were overly well done, mozzarella sticks were under cooked, it was just a hot mess!  I used to go here all the time, but won't be returning after my last couple visits.

Wow eight of us and the poor bartender worked the entire floor of this bar. No waitresses or support for him whatsoever. He did the absolute  best he could. Another note, didn't know it was bring our toddler to work day for hostess/waitress. I love kids but not fond of toddlers running around the bar. Appetizers and drinks good but needs this place needs to check out what's up.

Went in for my daughter's 14th birthday, waitress, Naomi deserved ten stars for calling my mother "high maintenance" but not sure I'd recommend saying anything like that to other customers. The food and service was great, the drinks and food came as expected time wise! We have been here a few times and we always seem to have good food and service. We will be going back the menu has quite a variety of choices for all family members. The prices are about average for this menu choices. We will be back!

Pretty terrible service at the bar about two weeks ago on a slow Tuesday. Bathroom was a disaster. Food was decent, I never expect these chains to blow me away. Overall, this place reminded me why I stay away from chains like Applebee's, Chili's etc.

I know TGI Fridays is geared more to being a sports bar or whatever, but I expected better food wise. I went out with my family after attending a ceremony and wanted a sit down meal near the location. I wish we would've gone elsewhere. We were seated right away, and for a Friday night it wasn't busy at all. Our waitress was obviously having personal issues, she looked like she had been crying, and I felt for her, but we had to ask 3 times for her to bring napkins, she would take our drink cups to refill them, and not come back for 20 minutes. I felt like I was in France where u literally have to call the waitress every single time you need something else. It almost seemed as if we were an inconvenience for her. Now onto the food. My mother ordered a clam chowder for her meal  & it was literally filled ALMOST half way. When we asked about it, they said they fill it by ounce and if we wanted more we can order another one. My salad was a black ahi tuna Cobb with pomegranate vinaigrette,  the dressing and ahi was delicious, but the avocados were brown and I had asked for no blue cheese on it, and yet my salad was covered in blue cheese! All in all we did not have a very good experience here. And I just felt bad because this was supposed to be a celebratory dinner for my sister who got accepted to the national honor society! I will NOT be going back to TGI Fridays again.

The service was terrible.  Should have known it was going to be a bad experience AGAIN, we we saw who our waiter was.  We ordered our food and our appetizers. 30 mins later we finally got our appetizers, 2 mins later our good came out.  We had to ask for more water. We ordered another round of pot stickers and we received them just before we left, 20 mins after ordering.  We had two coupons for free appetizer or desert. We used one and gave the other one to the table behind us because we are never coming here again.

horrible. awful service, waited 10 minutes after being sat for anyone to come over to us. it wasnt even busy. our waitress only cane to get our order and we never saw her again. multiple managers and other servers helped us, brought our food, checked on us, brought the check, cashed us out. food was ok, we came for endless appetizers but nobody said anything about it. after looking it up online i noticed the apps i wanted werent offered for that   we just did regular apps. i dont know why i always think the food is going to be so good, it never is. and thats just with tgif in general. if we had had good service we might think about coming back. but now definitely not. especially because we drove 40min to get here.  not worth it!

Came here today and I had such a great time. I enjoy the food it was really good and it taste amazing.  I also enjoy the Magic show that the guy provides while you wait for your order. They entertain you so much that I enjoyed my time. Also I had great customer service, I will definitely come here again.

I'll give 2 stars, only cause the food was good. Jack Daniels burger was my choice. Cooked perfect. It's just a burger. Amber was our server...not impressed. Forgot our pretzels,  no dinner ware. Extremely pushy about us ordering, even after 4 times of telling her that we were waiting on another person. And the other blond waitress that kept walking by and barking orders on what we need to do with our menus when we're ready to order. She wasn't even our waitress!! 3pm on a Friday, shouldn't be such a hurry. Hell, I'm paying 70 bucks for 4 people to eat, I shouldn't be made to feel i need to hurry. Haven't been to this location in 8 years, and it's gone down hill big time in service. I was in the service business before, and a bad day should NEVER be reflected on the customer. I will not be going back to this location.

Never again will be going to TGI Friday... My food was burnt, it took so long for our food to come.  Plus it took a long time for our waitress to service After we sat down.  The worst burger that I ever had for 35 years!

Worst service ever! We got seated and it took forever and a day for our waitress to come take our drink order. WOW!  Called to make birthday reservations 3 days ahead of time and they said they can't accommodate us. i love tgif spinach dip. the only reason i would go back is because of the dip. i ordered a smoothie that i always do when i go there. it didnt taste the same. the customer service is okay. takes forever to get something. takes awhile to get the check. the food was okay.

I have to give them a 2 because I walk in at 11:00 PM on a Thursday night and I honestly hated it, NO one was there to serve us. We ask for a menu he says alright he comes back. And then we wait for 20 minutes for him to ask what can I get you? I honestly Just left

I will make a long story short, the last two times I went there, with my family, the food was below average, I will give it one more chance, to see if they correct the problem, if not I will find another restaurant where to spend my money!

Wednesday nights really jump off here.  I've come across a line on several visits.  A line??!!!  For Friday's?!  Crazy. Lots of local youngin's trying to party up because they don't have the gas money to make it out to LA or Hollywood.  Lots of older gentlemen trying to pick up because they have early bed times and want to stay local. It's ok the first few times you go, but after that you better start re-evaluating your life and why you keep coming back. Seriously...

So I came in with my family of four on Friday night at 7:30 and was told it was a 15 minute wait which seemed fine as there were a few people already waiting ahead of us,  the host up front asked my family if they would like to see some magic tricks while we waited for a table and so we said yes, and wow were we impressed with him, he was funny and cool to watch and he made waiting enjoyable. On top of that we only waited 10 minutes tops to be seated, once seated our waitress got to us fairly quickly and took our drink order, we got our drinks quick and ordered. We got some boneless wings for appetizers, they took 20 minutes to come out and were cold. By the time we got our entrees it was another 25 minutes. The food was pretty good but took to long to come out. The waitress I think her name was Savannah was attentive and polite but honestly seemed a little inexperienced. The magic was the best part and is why I'm giving this place 4 stars would be 3 otherwise.

Would give zero stars if I could. Where to start? Well first off, the waitress took over 20 mins to get to our table just to take our drink order. Mind you, my bf and I went there at 10 pm after work and there weren't too many customers at TGIF so it didn't make any sense to us as to why service was so slow. After finally getting our drinks, we had to wait another half hour before she came back to take our order. Skip forward to when our food arrives. I ordered the JD sampler and my bf ordered the steak and salmon. Food was just terrible. Point blank. The ribs were tough, dry, and bland. The Asian chicken strips were burned. The shrimp was cold (yet it's meant to be Cajun fried shrimp??). His steak was not cooked the way he ordered (medium well but came out rare) and the salmon was just okay, no flavor to it. Neither of us actually managed to finish more than half our plates coz it was so bad. At no point during our dinner did the waitress come by to refill our drinks or take our plates away - we had to ask another staff member to bring us the check and remove the dishes. Made sure to leave as soon as possible after paying. Did not tip since we felt she did not deserve it for terrible service. My advice: don't bother dining here at all. There are much better restaurants nearby like Karl Strauss, Corner Bakery, and any other restaurants by the mall. Will definitely not be returning and I advise you don't either. Save yourself the trouble of dealing with their pathetic customer service and eating their so called food. Zero stars.
Monday and Wednesday nights they have a DJ!! Lots of people were there the night I went...dance floor was jammed packed.  The restaurant is still opened on one side of the restaurant too.

I usually come here to eat and for the most part everything is outstanding. However, this time was awful. I ordered the chicken and shrimp skillet and the chicken was really small. The overall presentation of the meal looked horrible. Is was not fresh or hot. Several if the meals in my party had to be returned. Worst experience ever. Also, the men's bathroom was horrible. The sink counter was soaked with water and there was paper towels all over the place. Trash was over flowed

Ordered Pear sangria, shrimp cocktail, salmon&shrimp scampi, steak&shrimp and brownie something. Everything was so-so. We didn't get shrimp cocktail...I guess waiter forgot. There are so many better restaurants around this area so I'm not going back.

Iv been going here for years and years usually once every 3 months. Food has always been delicious, Servers were always friendly and there for my every need, no waiting. My favorite is the sizzling shrimp and chicken with mashed potatoes and bruschetta pasta, salads and there chicken appetizers....The Bomb!!! Ribs, and anything with there Jack Daniel sauce is good too.....I just got back from there and it was great once again.

We went there on a Saturday night expecting to be there a while having various cocktails, appetizers and dinner, maybe even dessert. They sat us at a booth in the bar, our server Carla came to take our drink order. My husband and my friend got their drinks but mine did not come. We got our appetizer, still no drink for me. We were literally right next to the bar and could see the bartender wiping stuff down and putting stuff away , trying to look busy but not serving anyone at the time, they were not very busy. We reminded our server about my drink, she said she would go ask about it. We had decided what we wanted to order for dinner, it took a while for her to come back, she finally comes back but does not stop at our table. She sees my husband wave at her and asks him if he's like another beer. He told her that he would rather have my first drink and we were ready to order dinner. She said she was sorry, she would check on my drink AGAIN and bring over a manager. She disappears again, no manager ever shows up. Next time we see her, still no drink, we told her to cancel the order, we would just like our check so we can leave, She said she would take my drink off of our bill, no apology, no manager. We paid our bill, no manager. We were prepared to spend a lot of money that night. What a shame ! We ended up going to BJ's where they treated us like VIP's

Honestly, the only reason why I ate here was because I had a "buy one get one free" coupon.   Most of their food tastes like it was reheated in the microwave.   The mashed potatoes was the only thing worth saving.

Coming from the uptime TGIF back home in Chicago. This place SUCKS!! Let me explain why. At the tgifs back at home their specials were actually specials. Every day of the week there would be a variety of specials. My fav. Was Thursday $3 mojitos, margaritas and $3 appetizers. So I went on a Thursday last week and was super disappointed. They don't have the same special. The crowd was non existant, it didn't have a great atmosphere or even nice loud music. Most tgifs I go to country wide have almost club music playing its nice and loud and they always have people in even on workdays. When I went to this Tgif it was like going to a funeral. Not loud music, not even current hits, hardly anyone inside, drinks weren't that great and the specials are terrible. Goodbye Tgif your dead to me now.

I wanted to write a review but I don't know. The hostesses and waitresses were nice but a little sloppy. I wasn't able to tell because they had MASSIVE mammories and a bottom to match. The hostesses and waitresses were white and Mexican but all had a healthy dose of Vitamin DD. It was hard to get my order down because I was staring... It was like very hour was happy hour for me. Staff was really nice but they talked to each other too much instead of paying attention to customers... But overall good.

I just signed up to yelp to make this review. Stopped by for a beer but decided to get food. The jack Daniels sampler was really good, also got some onion rings that were decent, and a small appetizer of bruschetta that was mouth watering. Server was very friendly and attentive. I think his name was John & he really went above and beyond.

ALways a good time here. I only come here for the food and the drinks not for their club days or whatever it is called. Their service is good, food is delicious. havnt found a menu item that disappointed me yet. Try em out!

If you have the option of eating elsewhere, please do.  The food was atrocious and left my boyfriend and I feeling queasy for the remainder of the evening. He got sliders and found it difficult to even get through one due to them not being cooked well, plastic cheese, tasting stale, and the tomatoes being dried out.  I could not even get through my pretzel appetizer for several reasons; the most glaring being that they tasted like bread sticks not pretzels and came with "cheese" sauce that already had a skin on it upon arriving to our table.  I attempted to be open minded thinking perhaps it just cooled too quickly and tried it anyway. It was terrible. It tasted like plastic, the chives were old and wilted, and the bacon in the sauce was rubbery.  Do yourselves a favor, and eat anywhere, anywhere, other than this restaurant.

TERRIBLE fries. These are some of the worst fries I've ever had. They were grossly overcooked and tasted like they were made yesterday and microwaved today then put on my plate. The service was terrible also. If you want a drink refill prepare to wait forever for it, if you even get one at all. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the Cheeseburger was pretty good. Overall though this place is bad and I would stay away.

Awful service in the bar. One bartender in particular is always complaining that he is "too busy" and doesn't appear to want to do anything that creates any effort. Also- asked to see a manager- and one never appeared. Meanwhile there are at least 7 servers standing around and chatting with each other. Wait 25 minutes AT the bar to get a beer & happy hour food order? Unacceptable. Do not come here if you don't have several hours to waist.

The food was decent, however the only two times I've visited this place noticed that the service was slow. I walked to the restrooms in the back and saw about 4 or 5 waitresses just chatting. I understand that people need to take a break once in a while, but not all 5 of them should be in the back standing around, I saw them doing it again when I used the bathroom once more before leaving. It takes so long to wait for someone to come over to take your order. It's only worth to go during happy hour because I would not want to pay full price for such service.

Our group of 5 came here and the food was terrible. All of our dishes were cold-and we had to send one back. It was not crowded so I don't understand why the food was so lousy. I do not recommend this place.

Wow went on a Thursday, 10-3-13 at 6:30 waited 20 min for a table for 6, ended up seated by the kitchen door. Ok we had two kids. (very well behaved) Servers were slow. Drinks took forever. Then 3 other Families were seated with screamers. OK families I get it but the servers kinda forgot our food and it was semi cold when it came out. My salmon was cooked  so hard it was like a flip flop on my plate. This place needs Willie Degel. Chef needs some lessons and the staff need to get some training. We will not return.

awful awful awful! one star is too generous honestly! service is so so so slow. we went on a week day right as they opened and it took us an hour to get our food! i would not want to see how slow it is when they are packed! my sons grilled cheese was so hard he couldn't even eat the bread,he just picked off the cheese!!! same with my sandwich and honestly i wouldn't be surprised if my soup was from a can!!! it took another 45 minutes just to pay and get our change! it was all around bad and i never want to go back. do not be disappointed go somewhere else!!!

Came here to fufill my "no meat on fridays" satisfaction. Ordered crispy green bean fries off the happy hour menu, Friday's shrimp with veggies and a side of the jack daniel sauce. Washed it down with hennessy with 7. Not a very balanced diet, i know, but i was feeling good after i left :) Would come here again

Bad management..horrible service. 12am not busy at all still had to wait 10 mins to get seated..with no workers in sight. Finally bust boy comes over to tell us he'll be right back to seat us after he cleans a booth. When there was 10 open booths CLEAN!! He comes back 5 mins later..gives us menu. As we sit there for 10 mins and wait we get no service no drinks NOTHING! We decide to walk but expressed ourself to the female manager who seem like she really didn't care and wasn't even apologetic about it! And even then we had to look for her to complain! Horrible!!

won't do this again. The menu pictures are a joke compared the food actually served and then when you send it back, they act like they're doing you a favor by not charging you for it. Server was good but what they had him bring out was just wrong. I'll stick with Chili's for quick family dinners.

The dessert was good but the pasta dish was mediocre.  Service was ok, could have been better.  Bartender made me some hideous drink when I just wanted a simple shooter, but was nice enough when I pointed out his mistake.   We went for dinner and karaoke so were there till half past 1.  Service seemed to stop right after we paid our tabs a few hours earlier.  Would have been nice to have some ice water offered...
Worst place ever if you want to stop by late night and grab a bite to eat! Waiters take forever to come to your table!
Endless shrimp with the meal, now thats a deal, because it's all shrimp, less batter and freshly cooked and of course any dessert is good

"The worst place I've been so far".  The only reason we went there is because my son got  "star of the week  coupon" at school  and really wanted to go there. Ordered food at 6:00 pm and waited 40 minutes to get it. The portions are very small. Paid $15.99 for their best Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp  and was disapointed. The burgers for kids are small and without any vegies.French fries and onion rings are horrible. The waitress forgot to bring ranch dressing for my child's salad and we had to wait extra 15 min to get it.   I believe , the burgers in "IN and OUT" for $1.75 are better than theirs. Will never go there again.

Nothing bad to say. Great happy hour prices, plenty of bar seating and outside seating is good too. Love all their different appetizers and lots of tv's to watch some sports. Service was prompt, friendly and brought our drinks fast!! Couldn't ask for anything better. Flat iron steak with the jack daniels sauce was so good. Wish we lived a little bit closer otherwise we would be here way more!

My favorite place in T-town to do my pre-party drinking. They have THE best drink specials and half price off during happy hour, which also is after 10pm! WOOT! Anywho they have a lot of different kinds of drinks and even my favey beer hefeweizen! Yum! This is a great place to come to pre-party in my opinion... you can feel REAL good for a great price before you go out! The restaurant is great too. All their food is pretty tasty and the service is very fast.  P dot S dot: Native Temeculians beware, it can turn into a high school reunion with all the losers who ended up going to community college for 6yrs.

I've had some good times here. Decent place to hit up for the late night happy hour deals. Great for groups. My only complaint is that on more than a few occasions, I've gotten an alcoholic beverage so watered down that I almost didn't even recognize it. For example, a cranberry vodka should not be barely pink and taste like water.

A regular hang out spot for me and my hubby. Good service. They have a DJ on wed or thurs nights which I always thought was funny. So if you go during these nights it may be louder than usual. Still fun though. Me and my hubby were regulars

Didn't have any table settings and had to remind our waitress for forks/knives/napkins. The place in general seemed run down and dirty (stained tables, trash on the floor, ect). The food was less then mediocre. It tasted very bland and was barely warm. For a $15 to $20 entree I at least expected it to be hot. Save yourself the time and head to BJ's or even Applebee's instead.

Yes, just like Rosie Y, I just came here for the BOGO coupon. I had the bruschetta (argh....however you spell it) chicken pasta. It was mainly...horrible. The best part about it was the balsamic reduction that was drizzled on top, but overall the flavor was too tangy (like raw tomato tangy) and unappetizing. I gave it 2 stars because Guinness on tap is $6! But probably for a limited time.  And as for what Derrick B. said, yes, I've seen the poser UFC fighters as well. I mean, we have a ton of wannabes here in the OC, but imagine those same guys...as the Inland Empire versions. As for the other types of patrons that he mentions, I'd say that some look good...but keep in mind...they're IE versions as well...

Me and my husband came here for a quick bite and a few beers . We sat in the bar ,the waitress was quick to take our orders and was very nice she brought our beers then about ten minutes later brought our food I had the Honey BBQ chicken appitizer took one bite and they where RAW!!!!! I asked the waitress to ask the manager to come talk to us, when she came over she kept saying it wasn't her fault and there's nothing to do about it.  We paid and left I will NEVER go back there again!!!!!

So, Saturday 10/11/14 was Chaparral High School's Homecoming.  No doubt that all of the restaurants in the immediate area know when the Temecula and Murrieta School District's Homecomings and Proms are, however, TGI Fridays was short-staffed and incapable of providing adequate (at the very least) service.  My daughter went to dinner before the dance with a large party.  Half of the party received their drinks and food.  However, after an hour, the other half of the party, my daughter included, never received their drinks or food.  When this was brought to the waitress' attention, she was indifferent and basically stated that they were busy and doing the best they could.  The manager on duty should be embarrassed and apologetic to the public if that is the best his/her staff could do.  It should be incumbent upon the manager(s) to make absolutely sure there is enough competent wait staff on duty when they know, in situations such as this, that there will large parties visiting their establishment.  When one of the mom's demanded to speak with the manager, the wait staff ran interference on producing the manager.  Every time I have patronized BJ's Restaurant, the manager on duty has always come by my table, large party or not, to inquire about the service we were provided.  Needless to say, neither me nor my family will be patronizing TGI Fridays at any time in the near future.
The flat iron steak I ordered in medium rare was so rare & bloody. I was only able to take 3 bites & my sides got completely soaked in the blood running off of my meat.

So disappointed with the managements' service. We hold a monthly luncheon there for over a year and they booked someone else, didn't tell us, and were totally unapologetic. Not a great way to treat local locals in this economy.

We haven't been to a Friday's in years and decided to go for dinner. We had the WORST service from the moment we walked in the door. Our appetizers were cold, we couldn't find our waitress to get drink refills and she brought me something different than what I ordered. I don't recommend this location.
Waitress had rude attitude immediately. The raspberry basil margarita I ordered tasted like salt water, returned it. Begrudginly ate the potato wedges we ordered them left. I'll pass next time

Terrible customer service . The girls at the front just finished their conversation while we were standing  there before we were even acknowledged  Then they acted like we were causing them some sort of hassle standing there waiting to be seated  The food was good but also the waitress wasn't very attentive and it just took too long to get any drinks out - beers not even a cocktail or anything

Family (of four) night out there on 06/19/15. Slow service, small portions, happy hour prices (Does not apply outside of the bar area), and establishment appears to cater more to those that are gathering with friends for drinks (not for Families out for a meal). This was our first experience at TGI Fridays as a Family and it will more than likely not happen again !!!!!!

Never got a chance to eat at this restaurant. Entered a he restaurant and were never acknowledged or greeted in any way. Several employees were standing in the back looking at us, but never came out. We left and will not be back.

The worst customer service I have had in a long time. I had to ask other servers to refill our drinks, had to get up and get my own things several times (i.e. silverware, napkins) etc. even my children commented "where is our waitress??"  Then when she would appear... No apology or any type of courtesy.  I was disappointed. The food was fine but we will not be returning. There are many more restaurants in the area which we will give our business to.
Waited for 10-15 minutes when it wasn't even crowded. Saw 2 open booths, but they wouldn't seat us. Decided to go next door to Karl Strauss. Got seated immediately

Wow... Worst customer service goes to my server last night. The host was not friendly just a "How many?" with a not so great attitude. Didn't even say "your server will be right with you..." Just dropped out menus and left. Waited for our server for 20 mins. (Keep in mind she didn't come around yet to ask what kind of drink we wanted.) Finally she came and wasn't so friendly from the start. No introduction, just "what kind of drinks did you guys want?" WHAT?? -.- After we're done ordering, we'll say "thank you", but doesn't say anything. Didn't even say "excuse me" when she was reaching for the menus, just reached into my personal bubble which I hate. -_-"  Anyway, our food finally came and normally servers call out the name of the dish and hands it to the right person but she just placed everything on the table. She was in a rush and didn't even give us a chance to let her know that we were missing a basket of fries, one of the order was wrong and a refill on my water. But noooooo, she just left after she dropped our food. Never once did she come around and checked up on us. She just dropped our bill, didn't even say "thank you or have a nice night", and left. Did we tip? OH HELLLLLLL NO.

Wow. I got the appetizer endless for $12 deal with a few friends. And I have to say. It was horrible.  There was not a single good one. The waitress was very nice and attentive but I really do feel mad that I even spent money here.  Definitely never coming back. Wayyyyy too low of quality. It's like the chef wasn't even trying. I mean seriously.

For the total price we paid, we expected tasty food, but no, it was a very disappointing experience. Spaghetti was soggy and watered down sauce (1/5), sandwich was okay (3/5), and dragonfire salmon was so-so (2.5/5). Our waitress was funny and friendly, she basically had no filter, TMI kinda convo about her life, but we didn't mind. We inhaled the red velvet cake (4/5) to comfort our disappointment, then off we go. I'll prolly skip this restaurant in the future.

Would've been 5 stars but they didn't cook my boyfriends steak the way he asked. The service was excellent, I really enjoyed my turkey burger, but I just can't understand why it's so hard for people to cook a steak medium rare? Why even ask how he wanted his steak cooked if you're going to bring it out well done? We seem to have this problem everywhere we go.  Other than that, no complaints! Their vanilla bean cheesecake is amazing.

Walked in at about 6pm finally got our food at 730ish. Service was soooo slow we saw several parties walk out. Our server was really nice and explained that he was cooking, serving and playing hostess. Luckily the food was good otherwise I would've really been mad. We had just spent hours in a car so waiting an hour and a half for food was kind of a break, on any other day I would've walked out like my fellow diners.  After our meal, the manager came out to apologize for the wait and not coming to see  us sooner. We were thanked for our patience and given a 50% discount on our entire bill. We just moved about 20 minutes away from this location and it happens to be the closest to us so although service was very slow, we will probably be back because the server was nice and food was good. Hopefully this was just a bad day for them.

Zero stars!! WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER.  Came in with my wife and son at  approx 12:30pm on sunday oct 9th.  Upon walking in we waited about 7 minutes before we were acknowledged by a hostess or anyone. We were then sat and another 10 minutes went by before anyone came to serve us.  In fact, after the hostess passed by us 2 times ahe ended up asking us if she could get us drinks while we continued to wait. Saddest part was the restaurant was pretty empty! Sodas were totally flat. Server finally came and explained the deals. We asked to immediately place an order of french fries and a slider for our son. She did that then came back to take our oder. We each ended up doing the $10 endless apps. After about 35-40 minutes the burger and fries came out and the burger was burnt to a crisp. The cheese on top was even black and it wasnt even hot! Completely inedible.  French fries were cold and stale.  The waitress came back and went to get him a new one. That took another 15 mins. Still none of our foot came out yet tables who csme 15 mins after ours were being seved 8 full sized entrees. Finally someone brought food,  yet it was for a different table. We waited pver an hour and 15 and received 1 plate that wasnt hot or even coated in sauce (wings) we ended up walkin out because the manager wasnt doing a damn thing to fix it. Finally the GM told her to comp the meal, which was obvious because we didnt eat! The 3 of us left starving and furious.  The manager even told me point blank "ya the endless apps is actually the worst thing to get" then why the hell do you promote it?!? There is so much more that happened but it would take forever to write.  Another  thing, every single person working there  was qalking around with the most miserable look on their faces. None of them looked as if they enjoyed their jobs or cared about being there. None of them had good customer service

Stopped in here for lunch while out running errands.  Not a good choice.  This location has been slowly going down hill over the last few years.  We were sat in a booth in the bar area, which smelled very strongly of mildew & old beer.  Not good when you are hungry.  The table wasn't completely wiped down, and the menu pages stuck to each other.  Was hoping that the food would be ok.  My husband had a cobb salad, which he said was good, and the dragon fire chicken dish my daughter got was tasty.  My shrimp/chicken alfredo was ok. Pasta was not cooked all the way though.  Our waitress Breanna, or something similiar was lacking in personaility.  Very unfriendly.  And the staff wouldn't move out of the walk through area when you are trying to walk by.  And they all were just gathering around chit-chatting.  Hmmm...with so many great food choices in the Temecula area, I'm thinking TGI Fridays will not be on our list for the future.

Every time I come here during evening times the service is HORRIBLE!! Here's a tip for all you hungry animals, "Go during the day." I swear it feels like there's only one bartender, one server and one cook. Never again!!

Can't tell you if the food or service was good because as we entered we were greeted by a horrendous odor....a combination of beer lines that haven't been cleaned forevor and sewage...we discussed and turned around and walked out.

I've always been satisfied with this place. Adequate service, consistent food quality and reasonable prices.  Last night that all would have been great.  Unfortunately, my friend and I were invisible.  We sat adjacent to the bar at a high top (bar section).  We patiently waited to be acknowledged, but the bartender was engaged in a conversation with 4 workers from Karl Strauss  (next door) and obviously enjoyed the non duties of her job while chatting with fellow industry workers.  After they moved to the outside smoking area, two men walked in and sat at the bar.  Without skipping a beat, the bartender greater them and asked what they were drinking. At which point, my friend and I walked out, deciding 5 minutes of being ignored was plenty.  Finally we we noticed and she called out "are you leaving?".  I responded "Yes, the lack of service was the reason".  While pouring the beers for the two recent arrivals, she called out that she was just on her way to serve us.  To ignore us is one thing, but to lie (I'm on my way, but pouring a beer) is simply insulting.

Two stars to be generous. Not only did they take absolutely forever to bring just two simple entrees to the table but they don't tell you that an already overpriced strawberry lemonade will cost another $0.49 for each refill, they got rid of yet another appetizer on the menu. Just a super frustrating visit that will be our last.

Decent service but these places have gotten insanely expensive. 28$ for the jack daniels ribs and shrimp. And over 6$ for a margarita on happy hour. That puts it around 50$ to get food and two drinks plus tip. Now I know why I stopped going here. The people making these prices should be slapped.
The wait is insane in this establishment. I've waited over one hour before and after the food. The food was okay, but the service was a disappointment.
A group of us attend once a month for their Karoake on Saturday nights; we always have an awesome time!!  The wait staff is friendly, the drinks are good.  Looking forward to the next event.

We like to come here for happy hour. A couple of drinks and some Jack Daniel's Chicken Strips and we're good to go for the evening. From time to time, they offer dinner specials and we'll take advantage of that as well. The only bad thing is that on a Friday, it can get pretty loud and hard to hear someone sitting next to you.

i liked it very much my friend carmen took me the other day i had the pasta dinner with shrimp and chicken and italian salad with a glass of rasberry tea it got me full i recomend to everyone they were very polite nice resturant i give a five star.

I love going to this place. The have the best roasted red pepper and sausage and chicken penne. I also love their potato skins. Their chicken wings aren't to great. Well, they are sometimes, but lately they haven't. Every Wednesday, I believe, they have like a dj/club thing going on. It was pretty funny to see all the drunk people. Anyways, food is good. Service is okay could be better, but overall it's a good place to go to when you're hungry and it's late.

When we walked in for lunch today, the girl standing at the front door was very nice and seated us right away.Our server Emily was very sweet also, she did a really good job. The food was really good, my steak was perfect, just the way I wanted it.Over all it was a great experience (like all the other times we eat here)...I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family...keep up the good work T.G.I. Friday's.

My family stopped in to have lunch after our fitting at mens wearhouse.... We've been to this restaurant/location before so I was shocked that the food was horrible. The hostess was super friendly and our waitress was couteous and pleasant however we waited a really long time and there was no one else in the restaurant during the time we were waiting for our food. There was one table next to us already eating. It took over 25minutes.....my son ordered a grilled cheese and his french fries were very limp and cold to the touch and his bread and cheese were barely even melted. I had the french dip and the meat was not cooked very well nor cut up it was just thrown on the bun with cold onions that were barely even cooked. I was so disappointed. Out of all the many restaurants in Temecula, I would not recommend this place to anyone..Save your money and time and pick another place. Something has changed here and I will not be back.

This Fridays Restaurant  is where my family and I usually go for a good night out. Some areas could be a little cleaner (tables, bathrooms) but overall, food is great and staff is always friendly and fast. We usually have a 5-8 minute wait which I dont mind.

Wow, I didn't think service and food could get this bad!! The wife and I went there on an early Sunday evening to use her BOGO coupon.  Our waitress pointed out that the were offering their two dinners for $20 specials, so we decided to try that and save the coupon.  You share an appetizer, each get an entree with two sides, and then share a dessert.  We ordered mozzarella sticks, then both ordered the pork chop, and wrapped things up with red velvet cake with vanilla ice cream.  Everything was excellent!  We sat outside on the patio, and enjoyed the pleasant pre-dusk weather.  The six mozzarella sticks were delicious, and the right amount for and appetizer for two people.  The pork chop was grilled just right, and was perfectly seasoned.  One of the better pork chops I've ever eaten.  We both had mashed potatoes, and both enjoyed them.  My wife had baked beans, and I had onion rings.  A few of my onion rings were laying in the juice coming off of the pork chop, and consequently were a little soggy.  Other than that, the rest of the onion rings were fine.  While I was pretty full from the appetizer, main course, and the two sides, I did manage to choke down some of the red valvet cake and ice cream.  Very tasty, and refreshing.  My wife and I both enjoyed the meal, and thought it was a bargain.All in all, a very good dinner for two for a very nice price.

So this review is for TWO visits.  The first was on September 24 at 1:30pm.  Hubby and I were going to DMV (yuck!) and felt like we needed a good meal to build up our stamina for what we knew would be an interminable wait.  This was a Tuesday afternoon and, as we suspected, it was pretty quiet.  We stood for about 5 minutes while the manager talked on his cell phone.  A male waiter walked past us twice without greeting.  Finally the manager got off the phone and said, "Hello.  Let me get the hostess."  Finally a young lady str-o-o-o-olled over and asked if we wanted to be seated in the bar.  We said no thank you, we would like a table or booth.  Without even looking, she informed us that it would be at least a 10 to 15 minute wait (on top of the now 10 minutes that we had been standing there.)  We said thanks but no thanks and left. But, because I LOVE Jack Daniels glaze on steak, I convinced my husband to try it again yesterday.  Once again we arrived around 1:30pm and, again, the hostess was MIA, but eventually (about 5 minutes this time) she arrived and offered us a table.  Once seated (she seated us without eating utensils), Brittany, our server, was right there.  We started off the meal with chips and salsa, gave our order and started a REALLY ENJOYABLE dining experience.  Hubby got the Bruschetta Chicken dinner (a favorite of his) and I ordered the Jack Daniels flat iron steak.  His meal was perfect (he ate every mouthful.)  Unfortunately, my side of broccoli was cold (cold enough that butter wouldn't melt), but the baked potato and steak was AWESOME!  I ordered the steak medium rare and it was spot on!  Everything was delivered fast and Brittany, our server, attended to us without being too attentive.  It was a really good meal and a nearly perfect restaurant visit.  So now we will visit again and report if the first visit was an anomaly or if the second visit was just luck!
